title: Man City manager Guardiola donates 1m euros to coronavirus fight
description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola donates 1m euros to fight the coronavirus outbreak in Spain.

title: Tokyo 2020 Olympics & Paralympics postponed until next year
description: The Tokyo 2020 Olympic and Paralympic Games are postponed until next year because of the worldwide coronavirus pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Can couples meet up?
description: Couples who don't live together need to decide whether to isolate together, the government says.

title: 'The Olympics in 2021 will be a carnival unleashed that no-one will take for granted ever again'
description: Postponing the Tokyo Olympics was the right decision. When it happens it will be a carnival that no-one will ever forget, writes Tom Fordyce.

title: 'Heartbreaking' but a 'release' - how athletes reacted to Olympics postponement
description: Olympians including Katarina Johnson-Thompson and Adam Peaty react to the Tokyo Games being postponed until 2021.

title: Coronavirus kindness: Chefs serve up free meals to NHS staff
description: They will provide hundreds of meals for workers and their families over the coming months.

title: 'This is about protecting lives' - IOC chief says costs of Tokyo 2020 delay not discussed
description: Tokyo 2020's postponement is about "protecting lives" and costs were not discussed with Japan's prime minister, says IOC chief Thomas Bach.

title: Coronavirus in South America: How it became a class issue
description: Early cases involved wealthier people who have been abroad, but fears are growing for the poorest.

title: Coronavirus: 'I'm begging you, please be careful'
description: A woman being treated for coronavirus has made an appeal for people to stay home.

title: Coronavirus: UK brings in strict curbs on life to fight virus
description: Boris Johnson is facing calls for clarity after introducing drastic measures, including banning gatherings of three or more.

title: Coronavirus: ‘How is £94 a week going to pay anyone’s bills?’
description: Freelance gig economy workers say they cannot survive on the support offered by the government.

title: Coronavirus: What are the new restrictions and why are they needed?
description: The new measures will see shops closed and groups dispersed in order to fight coronavirus.

title: Albert Uderzo: Asterix co-creator and illustrator dies aged 92
description: The Frenchman illustrated the famous comic book series and eventually took over the writing.

title: Wetherspoon boss tells staff get a job at Tesco
description: Tim Martin says workers can take up jobs with supermarkets following the coronavirus shutdown.

title: Decision to postpone Tokyo 2020 could be made on Tuesday
description: A decision to postpone this summer's Olympic Games in Tokyo, due to start on 24 July, may be made on Tuesday, BBC Sport understands.

title: Coronavirus: Sadiq Khan warns 'stop Tube travel or more will die'
description: Commuters pack into trains for a second day despite the prime minister banning non-essential travel.

title: Coronavirus: Sports Direct U-turns on opening after backlash
description: Retailer says it will not open its shops "until we are given the go-ahead by the government".

title: Coronavirus: Spanish army finds care home residents 'dead and abandoned'
description: An inquiry is launched after soldiers discover elderly coronavirus victims "dead in their beds".

title: Coronavirus: Wuhan to ease lockdown as world battles pandemic
description: The lockdown in the Chinese city where the outbreak began will be partially lifted next month.

title: When They See Us: Netflix wins defamation case
description: A police training company brought the lawsuit against the streaming service for scenes on the show.

title: Golf courses shut in England, Wales & NI
description: Golf courses in England and Wales will shut following the latest government measures to tackle the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Champions and Challenge Cups postponed due to coronavirus outbreak
description: The Champions Cup and Challenge Cup semi-finals and finals have been postponed because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: England '66, Man Utd '99, Arsenal '04 - the iconic starting XIs who rarely played together
description: England's 1966 World Cup winners, Manchester United's 1999 side, Arsenal's 'Invincibles' - some of English football's most revered XIs barely ever played together.

title: England's Bronze named BBC Women's Footballer of Year
description: England and Lyon defender Lucy Bronze is named Women's Footballer of the Year 2020, having also won the award in 2018.

title: Newspaper headlines: UK 'under house arrest' as coronavirus measures 'end freedom'
description: Tuesday's newspapers are full of Boris Johnson's latest strict measures to tackle coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus update: Why does staying at home help?
description: After Boris Johnson brings in new measures, the BBC explains why staying in is a matter of life and death.

title: Coronavirus: How did Australia's Ruby Princess cruise debacle happen?
description: The Ruby Princess was allowed to unload 2,700 passengers in Sydney - now over 130 have coronavirus.

title: Trump says coronavirus not Asian Americans' fault
description: After criticism for using the term "Chinese virus", the president praises Asian Americans as "amazing".

title: Could synthetic fish be a better catch of the day?
description: Start-ups are growing fish "meat" in labs and say it will be competitive with fish from the sea.

title: Coronavirus: 'Just stay inside' pleads victim's daughter
description: Michael Gerard, 73, died in hospital on Sunday after getting pneumonia-like symptoms two weeks ago.

title: Remote working: Seven tips for successful video meetings
description: Workplace consultant Guenaelle Watson gives seven tips for better video meetings.

title: Antarctic seal photo wins top prize
description: A drone photo of crabeater seals resting on an ice float is overall winner in a nature photography competition.

title: Teen figure skater's Special Olympics dream
description: Thirteen-year-old Ornela has Down's syndrome and is training to compete in the World Games next year.

title: Ukraine's missing people amid ongoing conflict
description: Thousands of people have gone missing since the conflict started in 2014, according to the Red Cross.

title: Father rejects killer's rough sex defence
description: Chloe Miazek was strangled to death during sex but her father rejects claims that she consented.
